capabilities.name: Act with Integrity
capabilities.description: The role requires adherence to public sector values and ethical standards in the development and coordination of conservation policies and programs.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential for developing operational policy, providing technical guidance, and engaging stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: The role involves supporting a team and working with various stakeholders to achieve conservation outcomes, requiring effective collaboration.

capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Focus on achieving conservation outcomes through the efficient coordination of programs and policies.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: The role requires planning and prioritizing tasks to support the strategic direction of threatened species conservation projects.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Problem-solving skills are crucial for developing practical solutions to conservation challenges.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Experience in supporting project delivery is needed, indicating the role's involvement in managing conservation projects.

capabilities.name: Technology
capabilities.description: Experience in data management with Excel is required, showing the role's need for technological proficiency.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Engaging with stakeholders to support conservation efforts and policy development.

skills.name: Data Management
skills.description: Using Excel for managing and analyzing conservation data.

skills.name: Conservation Policy Development
skills.description: Developing and coordinating operational policy for threatened species and ecosystems.

generalRole.title: Conservation Project Officer
generalRole.description: This role focuses on supporting the strategic direction and operational delivery of conservation projects, particularly for threatened species. It involves policy development, stakeholder engagement, and project management within an environmental science context.
